visuals.title: The Complex Plane
visuals.description: The complex plane has a real axis (horizontal) and an imaginary axis (vertical). Every complex number A = a_r + ja_i is a point on this plane.

visuals.title: Complex Number A = a_r + ja_i on the Complex Plane
visuals.description: The real part a_r is the horizontal coordinate, and the imaginary part a_i is the vertical coordinate. The magnitude |A| is the distance from the origin, and the angle φ is measured from the positive real axis.

visuals.title: Rectangular vs Polar: Two Views of the Same Number
visuals.description: A = 3 + j4 = 5∠53.13°. The rectangular form gives the (x, y) coordinates. The polar form gives the distance and direction from the origin.

visuals.title: Interactive: Rectangular ↔ Polar Converter
visuals.description: Move the point on the complex plane and see both the rectangular (a_r + ja_i) and polar (|A|∠φ) representations update in real time.

visuals.title: Complex Conjugate: A and A* are Mirror Images
visuals.description: The conjugate A* is the reflection of A across the real axis. Notice that A + A* = 2·Re[A] (a real number) and AA* = |A|² (also real).

visuals.title: Euler's Formula: e^(jα) Traces the Unit Circle
visuals.description: As α goes from 0 to 2π, the point e^(jα) = cos α + j sin α traces out a complete circle of radius 1. Key points: e^(j0) = 1, e^(jπ/2) = j, e^(jπ) = -1, e^(j3π/2) = -j.

visuals.title: Interactive: Euler's Formula Explorer
visuals.description: Adjust the angle α and watch the point e^(jα) move around the unit circle. The real part (cos α) and imaginary part (sin α) update simultaneously.

visuals.title: Powers of j: 90° Rotation Steps
visuals.description: Each multiplication by j rotates the complex number by 90° counterclockwise. Starting from 1: j⁰ = 1, j¹ = j, j² = -1, j³ = -j, j⁴ = 1 (back to start).
